newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine telephone decision due this week - source.
newsitem.headline: Argentine telephone decision due this week - source.

text.p: Argentina's Supreme Court will make a final decision this week on whether the government can implement changes to telephone rates announced in January, a Supreme Court source said Monday.
"Definitely this week a decision will be taken on the matter, but the court has two other cases to resolve first," the court official told Reuters.

In January the government decreed changes to Argentina's telephone rates regime, increasing the cost of local calls and telephone rentals while slashing the rates for national and international long-distance calls.
The changes were challenged in the courts by consumers who managed to suspend the new tariff regime, while the government appealed against the suspension.
Telefonica de Argentina and Telecom Argentina had waged a long, hard lobbying campaign for the changes, which they said would make charges fairer for provincial businesses.
